alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Douglas; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 3:30AM CST until February 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches possible. * WHERE...In Wisconsin, Douglas, Burnett and Washburn Counties. In Minnesota, Carlton and South St. Louis and Pine Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Fond du Lac Band and the Mille Lacs Band, Lena Lake and, Hinckley areas. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a prolonged period of snow with the heaviest snow most likely during the day Monday and again during the day Tuesday. In addition to the snow will be gusty northerly winds, especially on Monday and near the lake. The wind will cause some blowing and drifting.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
